tournament.name: Friday 3rd Qualifier for MagicFest Online Season 2

decks.notes: The deck focuses on generating value and card advantage through powerful control spells and synergies with Fires of Invention. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Deafening Clarion, while also generating threats with Shark Typhoon and Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion to provide additional value by blinking permanents, and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast is used to cheat out powerful creatures. The deck also includes card draw engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea to maintain card advantage.

The deck focuses on using control elements and cards that provide card advantage and disruption to outvalue and outlast the opponent. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Tamiyo, along with board wipes like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death, the deck aims to control the board while generating card advantage through cards like Omen of the Sea and Shark Typhoon. With the addition of Yorion as a companion, the deck can generate even more value through blinking permanents and maintaining a strong board presence throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a variety of spells and abilities that disrupt the opponent's strategy while allowing the player to draw cards and ramp up their mana. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion adds a flicker element to the deck, providing additional value from enter the battlefield effects. The mana base is built to support the wide array of colors required for the spells in the deck, ensuring consistency in casting powerful cards like Niv-Mizzet Reborn and Casualties of War.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells, generating value through land ramp and card draw, while utilizing Wilderness Reclamation to untap lands and maintain a strong board presence. The deck aims to slow down opponents with counterspells like Negate and Mystical Dispute, while also creating threatening Shark tokens with Shark Typhoon. Uro provides recurring value and life gain, while Expansion/Explosion can be used as a finisher. Overall, the deck seeks to outvalue opponents and maintain control of the game until it can win through card advantage and powerful spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells without paying their mana cost. It also includes control elements such as Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck has a toolbox feel with Fae of Wishes allowing access to a sideboard of powerful cards. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra value. The key strategy is to control the game with a mix of removal, card advantage, and powerful threats while setting up for a strong late-game win condition.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast multiple spells for free each turn, enabling efficient control over the game. It includes a variety of powerful control cards such as Elspeth Conquers Death, Agent of Treachery, and Shark Typhoon, along with card draw and ramp spells like Growth Spiral and Omen of the Sea. The deck also features a companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, to provide additional value and flexibility. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the board while generating value and advantage through Fires of Invention.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free and control the board with cards like Shark Typhoon, Shatter the Sky, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Agent of Treachery. The key concept revolves around ramping up mana quickly with Fires of Invention to overwhelm opponents with powerful plays and card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Yorion, Sky Nomad and Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast provide additional value and synergies to create a resilient and versatile control deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing Winota's ability to cheat powerful creatures onto the battlefield by attacking with a mix of small token creatures and high-impact creatures like Agent of Treachery and Cavalier of Flame. Fires of Invention allows for explosive turns where multiple powerful threats can be played for free. The deck also includes cards like Charming Prince and Kenrith, the Returned King to provide additional utility and flexibility. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly with a combination of aggressive creatures and strong synergies.

The deck focuses on utilizing a high number of powerful control cards to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It includes a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to control the pace of the game. The companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, allows for additional value by flickering permanents for extra card advantage. The deck also includes a strong creature package to provide a win condition through creature beats or stealing the opponent's threats. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and strategic plays.

This Bant Control deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to drop powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Agent of Treachery, while using counterspells like Mystical Dispute to control the board. The deck also includes a variety of versatile planeswalkers like Nissa, Teferi, and Tamiyo to provide card advantage and disruption. Removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death help maintain board control, while cards like Uro and Omen of the Sea provide card draw and lifegain. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as the companion to enable more flexible plays and ensure consistency in the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free, while controlling the board with cards like Elspeth Conquers Death and Agent of Treachery. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra triggers. The deck also includes various card draw and ramp spells to ensure consistency and maintain control over the game. Overall, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and outvalue the opponent through a combination of resource management and powerful threats.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast high-cost spells for free. The deck includes powerful control cards like Agent of Treachery, Elspeth Conquers Death, and Deafening Clarion to deal with threats while generating value. The deck also includes Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast and Narset, Parter of Veils to provide card advantage and disruption. With a focus on card advantage, disruption, and efficient use of mana resources, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a long game.

This control deck focuses on utilizing Fires of Invention to cast powerful spells for free each turn, while also taking advantage of Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat big creatures onto the battlefield. The deck has plenty of card draw and disruption to control the game, with removal spells like Shatter the Sky and Elspeth Conquers Death to handle threats. Yorion, Sky Nomad acts as a companion to provide additional value and flexibility. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents with a combination of efficient threats and powerful interactions.

The main idea of this deck is to build a fast and aggressive strategy by utilizing cycling cards to trigger abilities and draw cards. By cycling through cards quickly, the deck aims to fill the graveyard to enable Zenith Flare as a powerful finisher. The deck also includes cards like Improbable Alliance and Valiant Rescuer to create tokens and maintain board presence while pressuring the opponent. Overall, the deck focuses on cycling as a major component of its game plan to overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of attacking creatures and burn damage.

The key idea of this deck is to utilize the Aggro strategy with a focus on a Sultai color combination. The deck includes efficient creatures like Knight of the Ebon Legion, Questing Beast, and Gemrazer, along with powerful spell options such as Brazen Borrower and Dirge Bat. The inclusion of Umori, the Collector as a companion adds consistency to the deck. Additionally, the mana base is carefully constructed to support the three-color combination, ensuring a smooth curve and access to all necessary colors of mana.

This deck focuses on playing a defensive game, controlling the board with counterspells and removal spells while drawing cards and generating value with cards like Narset, Teferi, and Omen of the Sea. The presence of Yorion as a companion allows for additional card advantage and flexibility in the late game. The win condition primarily comes from Dream Trawler and Agent of Treachery, which can close out the game once the opponent has been sufficiently controlled and the deck has stabilized.
